author: CatCloud

text:
It was kind of short, the voices were bad, the plot isn't that special, and there's a technique that makes you invincible that makes later boss battles a breeze. I didn't even get touched on the final battle...

But other than that, all the music was great, the environments were colorful, and the character/monster designs were cool. It was often challenging too, plus there's a hard mode after you beat the game (enemies are tougher).
author: Sephiko

text: I thought DC2 was a good game with very good cel-shaded graphics. To be honest, I've never been a fan of randomly generated dungeons so that hurt it a bit, but I know a lot of people who really loved it. I think it's the game that put Level 5 on the map.
author: SupraDarky

text: It's a very charming game, though obviously an early PS2 game. Did you like Musashi? I've yet to try it and I generally heard mixed things about the game.
author: SupraDarky

text:
Since I've finished SL: Musashi now, I'm gonna go hunt for this one.

This song's very relaxing, thanks for sharing.
